title: Practice Challenge
description: Apply what you've learned in this interactive coding challenge.
instructions:
Create a character status display! Make variables for:
1. isHungry (boolean) - set to true
2. isTired (boolean) - set to false
3. energy (int) - set to 75
4. name (string) - set to any name

Display all of them in a formatted status report!

hints.text: Remember: true and false have NO QUOTES! Write bool isHungry = true; not bool isHungry = "true";
Putting quotes around true/false: bool isReady = "true"; is WRONG! Use bool isReady = true; (no quotes!)
Capitalizing true/false: C# is case-sensitive! Use true, not True or TRUE.
Trying to assign other values: bool can ONLY hold true or false, nothing else!

commonMistakes.consequence: bool isReady = "true"; is WRONG! Use bool isReady = true; (no quotes!)
